metadata.name: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation
metadata.comment: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\\.exe', 'pwsh\\.dll')) AND process.cmd_line rlike '\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+.*\\\+' AND process.cmd_line rlike '\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{.*\\\{' AND process.cmd_line rlike '\\^.*\\^.*\\^.*\\^.*\\^' AND process.cmd_line rlike '`.*`.*`.*`.*`' AND NOT (lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('c:\\\\program files\\\\amazon\\\\ssm\\\\ssm-document-worker.exe') OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('new eventsource("microsoft.windows.sense.client.management"')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('public static extern bool installelamcertificateinfo(safefilehandle handle);'))))

output.summary: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Amazon SSM Document Worker 2. Windows Defender ATP Reference: https://speakerdeck.com/heirhabarov/hunting-for-powershell-abuse?slide=64
